title: Getting Started
text: This tutorial demonstrates how to use the utah_housing_stat386 package to scrape, clean, and analyze Utah housing data from UtahRealEstate.com. The package provides tools to collect data from cities in Utah County and Salt Lake County.

title: Getting Started
text:
Installation
The first things that you will need to do is install the utah_housing_stat386 package. pip install utah-housing-stat386
import utah_housing as
After installing, you’ll also need to install playwright browers to run the scraping functions.
This package includes a demo datset that you can use so that you can start exploring the data immediately!
from utah_housing_stat386 import demo_data

#load the demo dataset

df = load_demo_data()

#Display the basic information of the dataset

print(f"Dataset Shape: {df.shape}")
print(f"\nDataset Columns: {df.columns}")
print(f"\nDataset Description: \n{df.describe()}")
print(f"\nFirst few rows: \n{df.head()}")

title: Getting Started
text:
Understanding the Data
To understand the datatypes that we can, you can run
print("Data Types:"
print(df.dtypes())

print("\nSummary Statistics:")
df.describe()

title: Utah Housing Data Package - STAT 386
text:
from utah_housing_stat386 import get_data


import nest_asyncio
nest_asyncio.apply()

import pandas as pd

df = get_data(max_listings=5, cities = ['provo'], output="pandas")
print(df.head())
